content.question: How are keys generated?
content.answer: Keys are generated by taking the FNV32 hash of a completely random UUID. The UUID is generated by the uuid npm package, and should produce unique identifiers for everyone. If using random keys make you uneasy for some reason, you can manually set your keys with the hasher tool on this website.

content.question: What is a JSON?
content.answer: "JSON" is a user-friendly syntax commonly used to represent data.

content.question: How does this website use JSON?
content.answer: STBL Studio offers a JSON syntax to make working with STBLs for importing and exporting string tables. This is because JSON is much more easily readable and editable with a plain text editor than a binary STBL or package would be. In JSON format, you are free to add/edit/remove strings, load them into your own script, or change the order of entries.

content.content:
Expected JSON Format

The JSON format this website uses is very flexible. All string entries should have two properties, one called "key" (case insensitive) and another called either "value" or "string" (also case insensitive). The value for the "key" property can either be a plain number, or a string containing an 8-digit hex number, with or without the "0x" prefix. This flexible format means that you can paste in the JSON content shown for string tables in S4S, the output of the old STBL editor, or JSON representations of the StringTableResource in @s4tk/models.

content.question: Locale
content.answer: A specific language/culture pair that is officially supported by The Sims 4.

content.question: Primary Locale
content.answer: For modders, this is the locale that you plan on writing your strings in. For translators, this is the locale that you are translating from, NOT the one you are writing yourself.

content.question: Project
content.answer: All of the strings associated with a single mod, including their translations.

content.question: Workspace
content.answer: All of your personal data on STBL Studio, including your projects and settings.
